item.title: By: hagen
item.dc:creator: hagen
item.description: It's possible from data files as well, have a look at http://lowrank.net/gnuplot/plot3d2-e.html
item.content:encoded: It’s possible from data files as well, have a look at http://lowrank.net/gnuplot/plot3d2-e.html

item.title: By: mw
item.dc:creator: mw
item.description: Hi there; I have used gnuplot for years, but now I want to plot a 3D *curve* - that is, a curve thru 3D space. NOT a 'surface'. I've been told that gnuplot will only do that with functions (or probably, expressions), but not with data files. Is this true? Can gnuplot not plot 3D parametric curves from data? Thanks, mw
item.content:encoded:
Hi there; I have used gnuplot for years, but now I want to plot a 3D *curve* – that is, a curve thru 3D space. NOT a ‘surface’. I’ve been told that gnuplot will only do that with functions (or probably, expressions), but not with data files.
Is this true? Can gnuplot not plot 3D parametric curves from data?
Thanks, mw

item.title: By: hagen
item.dc:creator: hagen
item.description:
Hi Bo,
you have to run the complete <a href="./../../code/sphere.gnu" rel="nofollow">script</a> that is linked in the caption of Fig. 4. Then it should work as <code>r = 1.0</code> is specified in there. The code examples in the text of the blog entry are only for illustrating the principles they normally do not work via copy and paste.
item.content:encoded:
Hi Bo,

you have to run the complete script that is linked in the caption of Fig. 4. Then it should work as r = 1.0 is specified in there. The code examples in the text of the blog entry are only for illustrating the principles they normally do not work via copy and paste.

item.title: By: Bo Thidé
item.dc:creator: Bo Thidé
item.description:
Hi,
The first 3D parametric example, drawing a (piece of a) sphera does not work. When I try to run it I get the error messge:
"line 9: undefined variable: r"
There is no way I can reproduce Fig. 4. What am I doing wrong?
Bo
item.content:encoded:
Hi,

The first 3D parametric example, drawing a (piece of a) sphera does not work. When I try to run it I get the error messge:

“line 9: undefined variable: r”

There is no way I can reproduce Fig. 4. What am I doing wrong?

Bo

item.title: By: Salidas vistosas de planos y rectas con gnuplot y gimp |

item.description: [...] de geometría analítica en el espacio. Me ha impresionado las salidas vistosas que ha obtenido Hagen Wierstorf con su uso. Sin embargo, es muy laboriosa la colocación de etiquetas en los sitios adecuados; [...]
